page.title: 01Tamar Valley _ Introduction
page.content: This area is the Tamar Valley, bisected almost equally by the River Tamar which divides Cornwall to the west and Devon to the east. The area is mainly agricultural, with scattered hamlets and inhabited farms. In the following pages we have dealt briefly with life as it is in 1985, particularly in relation to employment, and recreation, as well as conservation, farming and river life. Special attention has been given to the more prominent places namely Halton Barton, the Pentillie Estate, Weir Quay and Halton Quay. The accompanying photographs are chosen to give a pictorial impression of both countryside and river.
